page.title: 13ASHPERTON - LAW AND ORDER
page.content: There is a police house in the village which has been empty since the local policeman bought a house in Ledbury and moved there. It is planned to find another constable to occupy it. The previous policeman and a woman police constable respond to any calls from this area. The policy is now to patrol in a police car stopping at sevaral places so that they are seen in a wide area west of Ledbury. The main need for police presence is at accidents on busy crosssroads. There are thefts of tools and electrical equipment but few cases of burglaries. Although there have been groups of thieves travelling into the area in search of antiques and silverware. The police are also responsible for moving travelling families off the verges along the highways.
